name: Alitalia
address: 1138 E Tremont Ave, Bronx, NY 10460, USA

reviews.text: I don't like to leave a bad review so I will give advice. 1-Use a better quality of mozzarella. 2- Improve you sauce some spices and high quality tomato sauce not the canned pizza sauce that it appears you are using. 3- Use high gluten pizza flour it does not taste like you are. If you are going to do the work to make the pizza the proper ingredients can make it great.
The people there are very nice. They‚Äôve been around for a very long time. Great food!
Love this place ‚ù§Ô∏è

I went in to get a chicken roll. The guy was making them fresh at that moment.  He put it in for me. I was running a little late for work. He guy asked where i worked and offered to have the guy deliver it for me since i was running late. Great roll and even better customer service.
Only pizza place in the area wish it was still 24hours
Great place, delicious old style pizza and more! Clean beautiful fast service!
The slices are big!   The Greek salad is out of this world .  The places is always clean.  The owner is very nice also.   Keep up the great work!
Food was good, ask for a chicken Parm, got chicken with lettuce tomato and mayo, was not bad at all, service was fast, employees were friendly
Amazing chicken slice and service

Amazing pizza, especially for the price. Always fresh and full of flavor. My go to, even if I have to drive there.
They were so kind and the pizza was huge for a good price. Definitely my go to spot now.
The pizza slices are huge
Love their pizza. Only order take out.
It was acceptable food wise
Pizza is a bit salty, and the crust is a bit thin for my taste. They also don't take credit cards...
good pizza but not worth the 3.50 they change the price too much and from what I know all the workers there quit so the pizza isn‚Äôt fresh anymore

My favorite pizza shop in my area delivery Is quick and their open later than other shoos
I absolutely love their slices. My honey eats the Gyros mainly. But we eat from there and it's a must try. They are open 24 hours too. Workers are friendly and clean. I trust the food.
Muy buena pizza,y el chicken parmeggiano buenisimo

No stars for this place.  Place is over priced Manhattan prices in the Bronx. Food is disgusting and refrigerated not fresh. Pizza is used from day prior they take it out the fridge. I asked for a fresh slice being that the pie he had out‚Ä¶

Beef patties are delicious so are there tacos along with the beef patty and cheese I also like the garlic knots. Pros they are open 24 hours come I hate the pizza it‚Äôs disgusting but can‚Äôt complain if your hungry late late and need something to eat. Prices are higher then normal but other then that can‚Äôt complain much.

This by far is the best pizza around chicken Caesar salad is spot on. The slices are huge and priced right. Too everyone that likes flavor don't eat here please enjoy the ketchup on slices bread your used too.

Overpriced for low quality products (cheap cheese, cheap tomato sauce) The garlic knots are merely dinner buns from the supermarket with garlic and oil brushed over them. I'm sure they're open 24 hrs because that's the only possible way‚Ä¶

I pass by this pizza shop on a daily but never go in unless is late and they are the only ones open and I am hungry. They pizza has no taste is bad out here. You gotta have the munchies to find flavor in their servings. When I look at the‚Ä¶

The products they use are of the best quality and it shows in every single bite, of this amazing pizza. The best pizza I have tasted in my 27 years of living in the Bronx, if you want the yummyest pizza in the Bronx then you have to taste a slice of Al Italia.

Horrible... No one takes the time to hear your order. The prices are too high for corner store food and the staff, if you are not a Spanish speaking person your order will always come out wrong evertime. I just wish there were another pizza spot in the area. That was more people friendly.

Good pizza and specialty items from breakfast and lunch to specialty pizza such as: white pizza, spinach pizza, chicken pizza, sausage and bacon pizza. Calzones of different fillings, meat and cheese, cheese, ham and cheese. There's something for every hungry taste buds here. Come in and give them a try.

Too expensive.   Why is a beef pattie with cheese $3.75.  And the pizza should only be $1 a slice because it sucks. They gave me a salad with lettuce and tomatoe and told me that wss 4.50 . for just lettuce and tomatoe!!!  . Smh
Good points: they stay open late hours in case you get the munchies.

this spot uses the same products as do those 'bullet-proof' kennedy fried chicken joints. You must be able to understand English spoken in a seriously thick Mexican Spanish accent. if your ordering over the phone make sure your order is‚Ä¶
I work in the area I feel that their prices are just right and the quality is very good. I ordered from there quite a bit and the deliveries are quicker than when I anticipated.

I LOVE THIS LITTLE PIZZA SHOP, A GOOD VIORITY OF DIFFERENT FAST FOODS, 24/7 BREAKFAST, SMALL & COZY. GRADE A- ALWAYS CLEAN!!.  I LIVE APPX 30 MINUTES AWAY FROM THIS TINY SHOP AND COME HERE ALMOST ONCE A WEEK FOR THEIR DELICIOUS BEEF PATTY‚Ä¶
